Returns: True if users are initially able to see street names on Street View panoramas
The initial position for the Street View panorama, or null if unspecified.

zoomGesturesEnabled(boolean).Description: Toggles the ability for users to zoom on panoramas using gestures. See @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama#setZoomGesturesEnabled_E@ for more details. The default is true

Returns: True if users are initially able to move to different Street View panoramas

streetNamesEnabled(boolean).Description: Toggles the ability for users to see street names on panoramas. See @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama#setStreetNamesEnabled_E@ for more details. The default is true

writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel, int).FullName: public void writeToParcel (Parcel out, int flags)

useViewLifecycleInFragment(boolean).Description: When using a @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanoramaFragment_E@, this flag specifies whether the lifecycle of the Street View panorama should be tied to the fragment's view or the fragment itself. The default value is false, tying the lifecycle of the Street View panorama to the fragment. Using the lifecycle of the fragment allows faster rendering of the Street View panorama when the fragment is detached and reattached, because the underlying GL context is preserved. This has the cost that detaching the fragment, but not destroying it, will not release memory used by the panorama. Using the lifecycle of a fragment's view means that a Street View panorama is not reused when the fragment is detached and reattached. This will cause the map to re-render from scratch, which can take a few seconds. It also means that while a fragment is detached, and therefore has no view, all @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama_E@ methods will throw @B_java#lang#NullPointerException_E@.

panningGesturesEnabled(boolean).Description: Toggles the ability for users to use pan around on panoramas using gestures. See @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama#setPanningGesturesEnabled_E@ for more details. The default is true

Returns: True if users are initially able to zoom via gestures on Street View panoramas

userNavigationEnabled(boolean).Description: Toggles the ability for users to move between panoramas. See @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama#setUserNavigationEnabled_E@ for more details. The default is true

Returns: True if users are initially able to pan via gestures on Street View panoramas

Returns: The initial radius used to search for a Street View panorama, or null if unspecified.

ClassDesc: Defines configuration PanoramaOptions for a @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanorama_E@. These options can be used when adding a panorama to your application programmatically. If you are using a @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanoramaFragment_E@, you can pass these options in using the static factory method @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanoramaFragment#newInstance_E@. If you are using a @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanoramaView_E@, you can pass these options in using the constructor @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#StreetViewPanoramaView#StreetViewPanoramaView_E@.
